answers.author: Robert Woods
answers.text:
Attached is an excel spreadsheet. It is used in the world of Lean and Six Sigma as a means of prioritizing and weighting any kind of projects.
Start on page 1 by assigning the Benefit metrics YOU want to use. I included our examples, and assign weights. Then the feasibility side.
On the Benefit page list the proposed projects. You assessment team reaches consensus on assigning points in each area, project by project. Repeat on the feasibility page.
On the final page you will get a graphical assessment where you can see the relative Feasibility/Benefit placing.

author: Tracy Miller
text:
The City of Fort Lauderdale, FL is revising their capital improvement process to include both quantitative and qualitative metrics for decision making and prioritizing.  City leaders would appreciate receiving examples of scoring matrices and measures from other cities.  Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.  
Best Regards,  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Metrics for CIP Process
